title: Classes without extensionality
content: A few results about classes can be proved without using ~ ax-ext . One could move all theorems from ~ cab to ~ df-clel (except for ~ dfcleq and ~ cvjust ) in a subsection "Classes" before the subsection on the axiom of extensionality, together with the theorems below. In that subsection, the last statement should be ~ df-cleq . Note that without ~ ax-ext , the $a-statements ~ df-clab , ~ df-cleq , and ~ df-clel are no longer eliminable (see previous section) (but PROBABLY are still conservative). This is not a reason not to study what is provable with them but without ~ ax-ext , in order to gauge their strengths more precisely. Before that subsection, a subsection "The membership predicate" could group the statements with ` e. ` that are currently in the FOL part (including ~ wcel , ~ wel , ~ ax-8 , ~ ax-9 ). Remark: the weakening of ~ eleq1 / ~ eleq2 to ~ eleq1w / ~ eleq2w can also be done with ~ eleq1i , ~ eqeltri , ~ eqeltrri , ~ eleq1a , ~ eleq1d , ~ eqeltrd , ~ eqeltrrd , ~ eqneltrd , ~ eqneltrrd , ~ nelneq . Remark: possibility to remove dependency on ~ ax-10 , ~ ax-11 , ~ ax-13 from ~ nfcri and theorems using it if one adds a disjoint variable condition (that theorem is typically used with dummy variables, so the disjoint variable condition addition is not very restrictive), and then shorten ~ nfnfc .

blocks.name: bj-cleljustab
blocks.content: An instance of ~ df-clel where the LHS (the definiendum) has the form "setvar ` e. ` class abstraction". The straightforward yet important fact that this statement can be proved from FOL= and ~ df-clab (hence without ~ df-clel or ~ df-cleq ) was stressed by Mario Carneiro. The instance of ~ df-clel where the LHS has the form "setvar ` e. ` setvar" is proved as ~ cleljust , from FOL= and ~ ax-8 . (Contributed by BJ, 8-Nov-2021.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm bj-cleljustab(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, wff w0) {
  |- wb(wcel(cv(s0), cab(s1, w0)), wex(s2, wa(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cab(s1, w0)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsw(s2, w0)
} = {
  3bitri(wcel(cv(s0), cab(s1, w0)), wex(s2, wa(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cab(s1, w0)))), wsb(s0, s1, w0), wex(s2, wa(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wsb(s2, s1, w0))))
  df-clab(s0, s1, w0)
  3bitri(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wex(s2, wa(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wsb(s2, s1, w0))), wa(wex(s2, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s0))), wsb(s0, s1, w0)), wex(s2, wa(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wsb(s0, s1, w0))))
  biantrur(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wex(s2, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s0))))
  ax6ev(s2, s0)
  bicomi(wa(wex(s2, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s0))), wsb(s0, s1, w0)), wex(s2, wa(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wsb(s0, s1, w0))))
  19.41v(s2, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wsb(s0, s1, w0))
  exbii(s2, wa(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wsb(s0, s1, w0)), wa(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wsb(s2, s1, w0)))
  pm5.32i(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wsb(s0, s1, w0), wsb(s2, s1, w0))
  equcoms(s2, s0, wb(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wsb(s2, s1, w0)))
  sbequ(s0, s2, s1, w0)
  exbii(s2, wa(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wsb(s2, s1, w0)), wa(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s2), cab(s1, w0))))
  anbi2i(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wsb(s2, s1, w0), wcel(cv(s2), cab(s1, w0)))
  bicomi(wsb(s2, s1, w0), wcel(cv(s2), cab(s1, w0)))
  df-clab(s2, s1, w0)
  diff.wsb.s(s2, s0, s1, w0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm bj-cleljustab(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (s0 ‚àà { s1 | w0 } ‚Üî ‚àÉ(s2,(s2 = s0 ‚àß s2 ‚àà { s1 | w0 })))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, w0)
} = {
  3bitri(s0 ‚àà { s1 | w0 }, ‚àÉ(s2,(s2 = s0 ‚àß s2 ‚àà { s1 | w0 })), [s0 / s1]w0, ‚àÉ(s2,(s2 = s0 ‚àß[s2 / s1]w0)))
  df-clab(s0, s1, w0)
  3bitri([s0 / s1]w0, ‚àÉ(s2,(s2 = s0 ‚àß[s2 / s1]w0)), (‚àÉ(s2, s2 = s0)‚àß[s0 / s1]w0), ‚àÉ(s2,(s2 = s0 ‚àß[s0 / s1]w0)))
  biantrur([s0 / s1]w0, ‚àÉ(s2, s2 = s0))
  ax6ev(s2, s0)
  bicomi((‚àÉ(s2, s2 = s0)‚àß[s0 / s1]w0), ‚àÉ(s2,(s2 = s0 ‚àß[s0 / s1]w0)))
  19.41v(s2, s2 = s0, [s0 / s1]w0)
  exbii(s2, (s2 = s0 ‚àß[s0 / s1]w0), (s2 = s0 ‚àß[s2 / s1]w0))
  pm5.32i(s2 = s0, [s0 / s1]w0, [s2 / s1]w0)
  equcoms(s2, s0, ([s0 / s1]w0 ‚Üî[s2 / s1]w0))
  sbequ(s0, s2, s1, w0)
  exbii(s2, (s2 = s0 ‚àß[s2 / s1]w0), (s2 = s0 ‚àß s2 ‚àà { s1 | w0 }))
  anbi2i(s2 = s0, [s2 / s1]w0, s2 ‚àà { s1 | w0 })
  bicomi([s2 / s1]w0, s2 ‚àà { s1 | w0 })
  df-clab(s2, s1, w0)
  diff.wsb.s(s2, s0, s1, w0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
}

blocks.name: bj-vexwt
blocks.content: Closed form of ~ bj-vexw . (Contributed by BJ, 14-Jun-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: bj-vexw
blocks.content: If ` ph ` is a theorem, then any set belongs to the class ` { x | ph } ` . Therefore, ` { x | ph } ` is "a" universal class. This is the closest one can get to defining a universal class, or proving ~ vex , without using ~ ax-ext . Note that this theorem has no disjoint variable condition and does not use ~ df-clel nor ~ df-cleq either: only first-order logic and ~ df-clab . Without ~ ax-ext , one cannot define "the" universal class, since one could not prove for instance the justification theorem ` { x | T. } = { y | T. } ` (see ~ vjust ). Indeed, in order to prove any equality of classes, one needs ~ df-cleq , which has ~ ax-ext as a hypothesis. Therefore, the classes ` { x | T. } ` , ` { y | ( ph -> ph ) } ` , ` { z | ( A. t t = t -> A. t t = t ) } ` and countless others are all universal classes whose equality one cannot prove without ~ ax-ext . See also ~ bj-issetw . Its degenerate instance is a simple consequence of ~ abid . (Contributed by BJ, 13-Jun-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: bj-denotes
blocks.content: This would be the justification theorem for the definition of the unary predicate "E!" by ` |- ( ` E! ` A <-> E. x x = A ) ` which could be interpreted as " ` A ` exists" or " ` A ` denotes". It is interesting that this justification theorem can be proved without ~ ax-ext nor ~ df-cleq (but then one requires ~ df-clab and ~ df-clel ). The next theorem ~ bj-issetwt will prove that "existing" (as a set) is equivalent to being a member of a class abstraction (that every class is equal to a class abstration is then proved by ~ abid1 / bj-termab , which requires more axioms, including ~ ax-ext and the three class related definitions). Note that there is no disjoint variable condition on ` x , y ` but the theorem does not depend on ~ ax-13 . Actually, the proof depends only on the logical axioms ~ ax-1 through ~ ax-7 and ~ sp . The symbol "E!" was chosen to be reminiscent of the analogous predicate in (inclusive or non-inclusive) free logic, which deals with the possibility of nonexistent objects. This analogy should not be taken too far, since here there are no equality axioms for classes: these are derived from ~ ax-ext and ~ df-cleq (e.g., ~ eqid and ~ eqeq1 ). In particular, one cannot even prove ` |- E. x x = A => |- A = A ` without ~ ax-ext and ~ df-cleq . See also ~ bj-denotesv and comments there. (Contributed by BJ, 29-Apr-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm bj-denotes(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wb(wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wex(s1, wceq(cv(s1), c0)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  bitri(wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wex(s1, wceq(cv(s1), c0)), wex(s1, wa(wceq(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), cab(hs0, wi(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0))))))))
  3bitr2i(wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wex(s1, wa(wceq(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), cab(hs0, wi(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0))))))), wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), cab(hs0, wi(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0))))))), wcel(c0, cab(hs0, wi(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0))))))
  exbii(s0, wceq(cv(s0), c0), wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), cab(hs0, wi(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)))))))
  biantru(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), cab(hs0, wi(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0))))))
  bj-vexw(s0, hs0, wi(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0))))
  df-clel(s0, c0, cab(hs0, wi(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)))))
  df-clel(s1, c0, cab(hs0, wi(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)))))
  exbii(s1, wa(wceq(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), cab(hs0, wi(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)))))), wceq(cv(s1), c0))
  bicomi(wa(wceq(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), cab(hs0, wi(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)))))), wceq(cv(s1), c0))
  biantru(wceq(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), cab(hs0, wi(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0))))))
  bj-vexw(s1, hs0, wi(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0))))
  id(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)))
  diff.cab.s(s0, hs0, wi(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0))))
  diff.wi.s(s0, wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cab.s(s1, hs0, wi(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0))))
  diff.wi.s(s1, wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)))
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(hs0), cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm bj-denotes(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  ‚ä¢ (‚àÉ(s0, s0 = c0)‚Üî ‚àÉ(s1, s1 = c0))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  bitri(‚àÉ(s0, s0 = c0), ‚àÉ(s1, s1 = c0), ‚àÉ(s1,(s1 = c0 ‚àß s1 ‚àà { hs0 |(hs0 = hs0 ‚Üí hs0 = hs0)})))
  3bitr2i(‚àÉ(s0, s0 = c0), ‚àÉ(s1,(s1 = c0 ‚àß s1 ‚àà { hs0 |(hs0 = hs0 ‚Üí hs0 = hs0)})), ‚àÉ(s0,(s0 = c0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà { hs0 |(hs0 = hs0 ‚Üí hs0 = hs0)})), c0 ‚àà { hs0 |(hs0 = hs0 ‚Üí hs0 = hs0)})
  exbii(s0, s0 = c0, (s0 = c0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà { hs0 |(hs0 = hs0 ‚Üí hs0 = hs0)}))
  biantru(s0 = c0, s0 ‚àà { hs0 |(hs0 = hs0 ‚Üí hs0 = hs0)})
  bj-vexw(s0, hs0, (hs0 = hs0 ‚Üí hs0 = hs0))
  df-clel(s0, c0, { hs0 |(hs0 = hs0 ‚Üí hs0 = hs0)})
  df-clel(s1, c0, { hs0 |(hs0 = hs0 ‚Üí hs0 = hs0)})
  exbii(s1, (s1 = c0 ‚àß s1 ‚àà { hs0 |(hs0 = hs0 ‚Üí hs0 = hs0)}), s1 = c0)
  bicomi((s1 = c0 ‚àß s1 ‚àà { hs0 |(hs0 = hs0 ‚Üí hs0 = hs0)}), s1 = c0)
  biantru(s1 = c0, s1 ‚àà { hs0 |(hs0 = hs0 ‚Üí hs0 = hs0)})
  bj-vexw(s1, hs0, (hs0 = hs0 ‚Üí hs0 = hs0))
  id(hs0 = hs0)
  diff.cab.s(s0, hs0, (hs0 = hs0 ‚Üí hs0 = hs0))
  diff.wi.s(s0, hs0 = hs0, hs0 = hs0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cab.s(s1, hs0, (hs0 = hs0 ‚Üí hs0 = hs0))
  diff.wi.s(s1, hs0 = hs0, hs0 = hs0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, hs0, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: bj-denotesv
blocks.content: Version of ~ bj-denotes with the additional condition DV(x,y). With that additional disjoint variable condition, a short proof is possible, which depends only on ~ ax-1 through ~ ax-7 and ~ eqeq1 . The latter is an axiom in free logic but in our axiomatization its proof requires ~ ax-ext and ~ df-cleq (hence ~ ax-9 ). Compared to ~ bj-denotes , it does not require ~ ax-12 nor ~ df-clab nor ~ df-clel (nor ~ ax-8 ). (Contributed by BJ, 29-Apr-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm bj-denotesv(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wb(wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wex(s1, wceq(cv(s1), c0)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  cbvexvw(s0, s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s1), c0))
  eqeq1(cv(s0), cv(s1), c0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(s1), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(s0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm bj-denotesv(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  ‚ä¢ (‚àÉ(s0, s0 = c0)‚Üî ‚àÉ(s1, s1 = c0))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  cbvexvw(s0, s1, s0 = c0, s1 = c0)
  eqeq1(s0, s1, c0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, s1, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, s0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

thm bj-issetwt(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wal(s0, w0), wb(wcel(c0, cab(s0, w0)), wex(s1, wceq(cv(s1), c0))))
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  3bitrd(wal(s0, w0), wcel(c0, cab(s0, w0)), wex(s1, wceq(cv(s1), c0)), wex(hs0, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cab(s0, w0)))), wex(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), c0)))
  a1i(wal(s0, w0), wb(wcel(c0, cab(s0, w0)), wex(hs0, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cab(s0, w0))))))
  df-clel(hs0, c0, cab(s0, w0))
  exbidv(hs0, wal(s0, w0), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cab(s0, w0))), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  bicomd(wal(s0, w0), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cab(s0, w0))), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  biantrud(wal(s0, w0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cab(s0, w0)))
  bj-vexwt(s0, hs0, w0)
  a1i(wal(s0, w0), wb(wex(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), c0)), wex(s1, wceq(cv(s1), c0))))
  bj-denotes(hs0, s1, c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cab(s0, w0))
  diff.hs0.w(wal(s0, w0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm bj-issetwt(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (‚àÄ(s0, w0)‚Üí(c0 ‚àà { s0 | w0 } ‚Üî ‚àÉ(s1, s1 = c0)))
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  3bitrd(‚àÄ(s0, w0), c0 ‚àà { s0 | w0 }, ‚àÉ(s1, s1 = c0), ‚àÉ(hs0,(hs0 = c0 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà { s0 | w0 })), ‚àÉ(hs0, hs0 = c0))
  a1i(‚àÄ(s0, w0), (c0 ‚àà { s0 | w0 } ‚Üî ‚àÉ(hs0,(hs0 = c0 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà { s0 | w0 }))))
  df-clel(hs0, c0, { s0 | w0 })
  exbidv(hs0, ‚àÄ(s0, w0), (hs0 = c0 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà { s0 | w0 }), hs0 = c0)
  bicomd(‚àÄ(s0, w0), (hs0 = c0 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà { s0 | w0 }), hs0 = c0)
  biantrud(‚àÄ(s0, w0), hs0 = c0, hs0 ‚àà { s0 | w0 })
  bj-vexwt(s0, hs0, w0)
  a1i(‚àÄ(s0, w0), (‚àÉ(hs0, hs0 = c0)‚Üî ‚àÉ(s1, s1 = c0)))
  bj-denotes(hs0, s1, c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c({ s0 | w0 })
  diff.hs0.w(‚àÄ(s0, w0))
}

blocks.name: bj-issetw
blocks.content: The closest one can get to ~ isset without using ~ ax-ext . See also ~ bj-vexw . Note that the only disjoint variable condition is between ` y ` and ` A ` . From there, one can prove ~ isset using ~ eleq2i (which requires ~ ax-ext and ~ df-cleq ). (Contributed by BJ, 29-Apr-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: bj-elissetv
blocks.content: Version of ~ bj-elisset with a disjoint variable condition on ` x , V ` . This proof uses only ~ df-ex , ~ ax-gen , ~ ax-4 and ~ df-clel on top of propositional calculus. Prefer its use over ~ bj-elisset when sufficient. (Contributed by BJ, 14-Sep-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: bj-elisset
blocks.content: Remove from ~ elisset dependency on ~ ax-ext (and on ~ df-cleq and ~ df-v ). This proof uses only ~ df-clab and ~ df-clel on top of first-order logic. It only requires ax-1--7 and ~ sp . Use ~ bj-elissetv instead when sufficient (in particular when ` V ` is substituted for ` _V ` ). (Contributed by BJ, 29-Apr-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: bj-issetiv
blocks.content: Version of ~ bj-isseti with a disjoint variable condition on ` x , V ` . This proof uses only ~ df-ex , ~ ax-gen , ~ ax-4 and ~ df-clel on top of propositional calculus. Prefer its use over ~ bj-isseti when sufficient (in particular when ` V ` is substituted for ` _V ` ). (Contributed by BJ, 14-Sep-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: bj-isseti
blocks.content: Remove from ~ isseti dependency on ~ ax-ext (and on ~ df-cleq and ~ df-v ). This proof uses only ~ df-clab and ~ df-clel on top of first-order logic. It only uses ~ ax-12 among the auxiliary logical axioms. The hypothesis uses ` V ` instead of ` _V ` for extra generality. This is indeed more general as long as ~ elex is not available. Use ~ bj-issetiv instead when sufficient (in particular when ` V ` is substituted for ` _V ` ). (Contributed by BJ, 13-Jun-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: bj-ralvw
blocks.content: A weak version of ~ ralv not using ~ ax-ext (nor ~ df-cleq , ~ df-clel , ~ df-v ), and only core FOL axioms. See also ~ bj-rexvw . The analogues for ~ reuv and ~ rmov are not proved. (Contributed by BJ, 16-Jun-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: bj-rexvw
blocks.content: A weak version of ~ rexv not using ~ ax-ext (nor ~ df-cleq , ~ df-clel , ~ df-v ), and only core FOL axioms. See also ~ bj-ralvw . (Contributed by BJ, 16-Jun-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: bj-rababw
blocks.content: A weak version of ~ rabab not using ~ df-clel nor ~ df-v (but requiring ~ ax-ext ) nor ~ ax-12 . (Contributed by BJ, 16-Jun-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: bj-ralcom4
blocks.content: Remove from ~ ralcom4 dependency on ~ ax-ext and ~ ax-13 (and on ~ df-or , ~ df-an , ~ df-tru , ~ df-sb , ~ df-clab , ~ df-cleq , ~ df-clel , ~ df-nfc , ~ df-v ). This proof uses only ~ df-ral on top of first-order logic. (Contributed by BJ, 13-Jun-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

thm bj-ralcom4(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0) {

blocks.content: Version of ~ bj-rexcom4b with a disjoint variable condition on ` x , V ` , hence removing dependency on ~ df-sb and ~ df-clab (so that it depends on ~ df-clel and ~ df-rex only on top of first-order logic). Prefer its use over ~ bj-rexcom4b when sufficient (in particular when ` V ` is substituted for ` _V ` ). (Contributed by BJ, 14-Sep-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

thm bj-rexcom4bv(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wb(wex(s0, wrex(s1, c0, wa(w0, wceq(cv(s0), c1)))), wrex(s1, c0, w0))
  -| wcel(c1, c2)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  bitr4i(wex(s0, wrex(s1, c0, wa(w0, wceq(cv(s0), c1)))), wrex(s1, c0, w0), wrex(s1, c0, wa(w0, wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), c1)))))
  bj-rexcom4a(s0, s1, c0, w0, wceq(cv(s0), c1))
  rexbii(s1, c0, w0, wa(w0, wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), c1))))
  biantru(w0, wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), c1)))
  bj-issetiv(s0, c1, c2)
}

blocks.name: bj-ceqsalt
blocks.content: Remove from ~ ceqsalt dependency on ~ ax-ext (and on ~ df-cleq and ~ df-v ). Note: this is not doable with ~ ceqsralt (or ~ ceqsralv ), which uses ~ eleq1 , but the same dependence removal is possible for ~ ceqsalg , ~ ceqsal , ~ ceqsalv , ~ cgsexg , ~ cgsex2g , ~ cgsex4g , ~ ceqsex , ~ ceqsexv , ~ ceqsex2 , ~ ceqsex2v , ~ ceqsex3v , ~ ceqsex4v , ~ ceqsex6v , ~ ceqsex8v , ~ gencbvex (after changing ` A = y ` to ` y = A ` ), ~ gencbvex2 , ~ gencbval , ~ vtoclgft (it uses ` F/_ ` , whose justification ~ nfcjust does not use ~ ax-ext ) and several other vtocl* theorems (see for instance ~ bj-vtoclg1f ). See also ~ bj-ceqsaltv . (Contributed by BJ, 16-Jun-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

thm bj-spcimdv(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  |- wi(w0, wi(wal(s0, w1), w2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c1))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wi(w1, w2))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w2)
} = {
  sylc(w0, wi(wal(s0, w1), w2), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wi(w1, w2))), wcel(c0, c1))
  alrimiv(s0, w0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wi(w1, w2)))
  ex(w0, wceq(cv(s0), c0), wi(w1, w2))
  syl6ib(wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wi(w1, w2))), wcel(c0, c1), wi(wal(s0, w1), w2), wex(s0, wi(w1, w2)))
  syl5(wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wi(w1, w2))), wcel(c0, c1), wex(s0, wi(w1, w2)), wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), c0)))
  bj-elisset(s0, c0, c1)
  exim(s0, wceq(cv(s0), c0), wi(w1, w2))
  19.36v(s0, w1, w2)
}

thm bj-spcimdv(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(‚àÄ(s0, w1)‚Üí w2))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà c1)
  ‚ä£ ((w0 ‚àß s0 = c0)‚Üí(w1 ‚Üí w2))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w2)
} = {
  sylc(w0, (‚àÄ(s0, w1)‚Üí w2), ‚àÄ(s0,(s0 = c0 ‚Üí(w1 ‚Üí w2))), c0 ‚àà c1)
  alrimiv(s0, w0, (s0 = c0 ‚Üí(w1 ‚Üí w2)))
  ex(w0, s0 = c0, (w1 ‚Üí w2))
  syl6ib(‚àÄ(s0,(s0 = c0 ‚Üí(w1 ‚Üí w2))), c0 ‚àà c1, (‚àÄ(s0, w1)‚Üí w2), ‚àÉ(s0,(w1 ‚Üí w2)))
  syl5(‚àÄ(s0,(s0 = c0 ‚Üí(w1 ‚Üí w2))), c0 ‚àà c1, ‚àÉ(s0,(w1 ‚Üí w2)), ‚àÉ(s0, s0 = c0))
  bj-elisset(s0, c0, c1)
  exim(s0, s0 = c0, (w1 ‚Üí w2))
  19.36v(s0, w1, w2)
}
